result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn L Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 45 days was granted.  Court orders the balance of the sentence STAYED as of December 15, 2014 and Defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 120 days.
3/06/2015 COURT IMPOSTED 4 MONTH HUBER WITH STRANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS CONCURRENT WITH 15CM38 AND COUNT 2 IN 14CM1949.  SENTENCE CREDIT FOR 55 DAYS GRANTED.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court sentences defendant to the following:
- 4 months  Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with 15CM38 and Count 2 in 14CM1949.  Credit for 55 days.
WCS Day Report Center Court Discharge Notice. Reviewed by the Court.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is expecting the defendant will be revoked and requests this matter to be scheduled with 15CM38.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Clarification of minutes from 1/16/15 hearing:  Court revokes Day Report Center privileges and reinstates the original 120 day Huber with standard release conditions as ordered on 12/3/14.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not to have Day Report Center privileges without the order of this Court.  If the Agent drops the hold, the defendant may have Huber privileges.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Filed by the Day Report Center in regards to the status of the defendant. Reviewed by the Court.
Based on non compliance with WCS, Branch 12 Only.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance. Reviewed by the Court.
Informing the defendant he should check on any potential tickets while serving on Day Report Center.
Jail Inmate Communications form requesting information on outstanding tickets.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 120 days Huber with standard release conditions.  Credit for 45 days.  Court orders the balance of the sentence STAYED as of December 15, 2014 and Defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 120 days.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is waiting for offer from the State.  Court will set matter for projected change of plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Shawn L Ross in court in custody with attorney Reisha Mitchell for Atty. Katie Beth Bricco.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2014 at 08:15 am.
